column4: Hi guys! I am having issues with a ralink wireless card in a laptop, anyone has experience with this chipsets?
Network controller: Ralink corp. Device 539f ---> Dumped by lspci
go to the ralink website go to software linux and d/l the 539x source file
extract the folder cd into it sudo make , sudo make install . then you'll have to black list the current driver being used in  /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist.conf . reboot and done
also keep the folder around because you'll probably have to use it anytime you update/new kernel
Sorry, was googling on my own a bit and didnt see your instructions
Downloading the driver from there as of now
http://ubuntulinux.co.in/blog/ubuntu/wifi-card-ralink-5390-configuration-in-ubuntu-10-10-64-bit/ theres a guide here too, if what i said didn't make much sense
Hi man! Your link made the card work like a charm, i am not using the old Linksys usb WiFi card anymore
Thanks... just another question, how can i get the exact model of this laptop? It has no model info anywhere, i only know its an HP Pavilion dm1 and i am having screen-bright issues
one sec running back and forth between the bbq .
glad it worked for you though!
Dont worry, its just the ATi driver doing its job, i think everythings fine now. Thanks :)
cool, lspci goes a long way for the future. chances are the model of your lappy really doesn't matter all that much
Ok, thanks, im off to configure everything for the final (new to linux) ubuntu user
Good luck with anything you are doing XD
